inn1.comm: starts with a wide down leg side. Short of a length, and sliding down
fuller, pitched outside leg, beats the flick and hits him on the pad
fuller still, drawing Tamim forward. Defended off the front foot
Tamim defends off the front foot again. No movement seen yet
wide down the leg side again. That's two for the over
short of a length, pitched outside leg, worked off the hip for the first run off the bat
short of a length, pitched outside off, holds its line sightly, steered away to third man
full, from wide of the crease, defended off the front foot
starts wide of the crease, gets some outswing, hits the outside half of Ashraful's bat, goes for a single
left alone outside off as this one angles away
driven nicely, but straight to cover
angling away again, defended with an open face
full, middle and leg, clipped away past square leg
short of a length, on the hips, concedes a leg-bye
defended off the front foot
nicely cut away, to the right of third man for a couple
short of a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
wide of the crease, angling down, takes a touch off the pad on the way
short of a length, hits the high part of the bat as he defends
short of a length again, takes the edge, and flies wide of slip. Second slip had just been taken out. How often does that happen?
pitched up, just outside off, angling away, beats the expansive Tamim drive
left alone outside off this time
nicely driven this time. The key is the straight face. He has placed this between the bowler and mid-off
short of a length, middle and leg, moves forward to push this towards mid-off with soft hands. Gets a single
dug in short, Ashraful drops his wrists, but the ball stays a little low and passes him by the chest
wide length ball, driven on the up, nicely between cover-point and cover
on a length, just outside off, left alone
beaten. A loose, late loose, shot. Stays back to an in-between length delivery. Seems like he will leave it alone, but flashes at it late. Misses
good short ball. Swift, at the body, defended off the back foot
pushed up this time, just outside off, Tamim watches this go
another watchful leave outside off
on the pads. That breaks the maiden. Tucked away for a single past square leg
moves in after pitching, but they take two leg-byes to fine leg
defended off the front foot as he pitches this up and on off
short of a length, just outside off, punched to cover-point
pitched up, just outside off, pushed to cover
punched away nicely, finds cover-point again
a lovely delivery to end the maiden. Moves away after pitching on a length and in front of off. Tamim pushes away from the body, and nearly edges it
short of a length, angling in, defended in front of off
pitched up this time, Ashraful is on the crease, defends in front of his body
full, on the pads, Ashraful misses out. They get a leg-bye, though

Tamim does a Tendulkar there. This one seams in from off and short of a length. nearly cuts him into two, and as the ball flies towards fine leg, he shows his bat to the umpire to make sure the runs are credited to his account and not extras. I don't remember batsmen showing their bat to the umpire when they are caught by the keeper. The umpire still calls it leg-byes
full, outside off, defended off the front foot
sweetly driven. Full, wide outside off, he gets the front across, and places it between cover and cover-point
dabbed to third man for one
length ball, outside off, angling away, left alone
wide down the leg side as he pitches this short, but outside leg
punched away off the back foot, but he has found backward point
this is fuller than the previous delivery, but not quite driving length. Left alone outside off
punched off the back foot, but can't beat that man at point
short of a length, middle and leg, played around the front foot to place it wide of mid-on for one
appeal for lbw but I don't see much swing. That was bowled from wide of the crease, pitched on off, might have straightened a touch, but not enough to be hitting the stumps
slashes at one shortish outside off, past the outstretched hand of gully
short of a length, just outside off, defended off the back foot
well done by gully and slip. Pitched up, hits the outside half of the bat, gully dives first to half-stop it, then Masakadza at slip dives to his right to stop it
that's a peach. Short of a length, pitched outside off, Ashraful plays the angle, but it seams away. Seams away too much to take the edge
and another beauty. This is slightly fuller, which means Ashraful is more tentative as he pushes at it. Beaten again by the away movement
short of a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
fuller, middle and leg, clipped away off the pads for a single
Masakadza gets a hand to it. A half chance really. Ashraful slashes at a short ball, gets a thick edge, it is flying away, Masakadza at slip leaps to his right, gets a hand to it, but can't hold on
left alone outside off this time
short of a length, widish, left alone
cut away to third man for one this time
on a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
and suddenly out of nowhere Ashraful pulls out a wild slash without any foot movement. He is nowhere near this widish delivery, and is beaten
short of a length, on off, worked to leg for one
cut away, but there is a deep point to cut it off now that the field restrictions are off
short, seaming away, Ashraful doesn't move again, but this time the mis-hit goes between gull and point for four
dabs on the top of bounce on this, gets a single to third man
walks across the stumps, but this is short and wide down leg side
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover. They don't want a single, but will get an overthrow thanks to a lob too high from the debutant Butt
length ball outside off, guided away to third man for one
walks across to work this length ball to leg for one
full, swinging into the pads, clipped away to fine leg for one
walks across again, defends a length ball outside off
defends a length ball outside off
starts off with a wide outside off. Full outside off, moving away
full, on the pads, worked away for an easy single
goes wide of the crease, strays down the leg side, concedes a leg-bye
full and wide, driven, but finds shirt cover with the shot
short of a length, too straight, tucked away off the hip
short of a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
this time he leaves one alone watchfully
even he starts with a wide. Down the leg side
loud appeal for lbw. This one did swing back in a little, which means it might have pitched within the stumps. Not give. No leg-bye given either
pitched up wide, driven to deep cover for one
full and wide, a gentle half-volley, driven past cover. Beats sweeper-cover too
strangle down the leg side. No dissent from Tamim. Short of a length, pitches leg, moves back in, Tamim looks to play it fine, gets too fine a touch, and Taylor takes a good diving catch
on a length, just outside off for the left-hand batsman. Defended
pitched up outside off, driven to cover
full, outside off, driven to sweeper-cover for one
full, outside off, pushed wide of mid-off for one
another wide from the wayward Chigumbura. Full and down the leg side. Seven of them so far
shortish, wide, Ashraful doesn't cut away at it. Nearly a wide again, but fine by a small margin
dug in short, Ashraful tries the pull, bottom-edges it towards midwicket
short again, opens the face to run this down to third man
short again, pulled away to deep midwicket for a couple
on a length, outside off, swings away a touch, left alone
full, outside off, driven to mid-off, who is up in the circle
thrashed away. Too full again, and this time he drives with an open face, and beats cover to his right

what a soft dismissal. Masakadza gets another wicket with a delivery down the leg side. On a length, on the pads, Ashraful can't resist lofting it. Finds the only man in the deep square on the leg side
left alone outside off
swinging into the pads, misses on the clip. Hit on the pad
on a length, from wide of the crease, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, angling in, defended
pushed in from wide of the crease, hits the pad, concedes a leg-bye
on a length, pitched outside leg, and Mominul misses out on those offerings
on a length, middle and off, defended with an open face
big wide outside off. Taylor can't get to it either
wild heave at a wide length ball. Beaten. He would have kicked himself had he got out to this shot
short of a length, moving back in a little, pushed to midwicket
on a length, outside off, angles away to beat the tentative push
on a length, on off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, outside off, angling away, Mominul is beaten as he tries to cut tentatively

a tough catch dropped by Utseya. Another poor shot from Bangladesh. Mominul, who has been tied down, just charges at him and throws his bat it. It scoops towards sweeper-cover where Usteya comes charging in, but can't quite hold on to it it despite his best effort
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for a single
short of a length, from wide of the crease, defended off the back foot
short of a length, wide, cut away to gully
short again, cut away in front of square, gets a couple for it
full, on the pads, clipped away
full, on off, driven to mid-off
short of a length, just outside off, dabbed away to third man for one
saved by the inside edge. This is full and swinging back in, hits him in front of leg, but Mominul gets a bit of bat on it
short of a length, wide, left alone
short, this gets high, between the shoulder and the head, but Mominul pulls this wide, through midwicket for four
short of a length, hip-high, worked away to leg for one
on a length, on off, holds its line, defended with an open face
short of a length, moving away from just outside off, left alone by Mushfiqur
short of a length, dabbed to the left of point for one
and another wide. Down the leg side
short of a length, into the pads, worked away to short fine leg
down the wicket, gets a single off the inside half of the bat
short of a length, cut away to deep point for one
full, defended back to him
short of a length, on the stumps, defended back to him

another wicket chucked away. Or is it? Mushfiqur is not too please walking away. Full, wide, half-volley, Mushfiqur doesn't get close to the line of the ball but still drives at it. Gets the edge, and is taken. Mushfiqur seems to be suggesting it might have been a bump ball. Replays show no such thing
another loose shot first up. Gets a thick edge as he pushes at it. Takes a single
dabbed away to third man for one
walks down the wicket and across the line, and then defends a length ball

Bangladesh keep throwing away wickets. A strange little innings from Shakib comes to an end. Shakib keeps walking across and down the wicket for some reason, gets an inside edge onto the pad, which rolls towards point. Mominul wants the single, but Shakib is sending him back, and then for some reason he makes a late decision to go for it. Too late to go back now as Waller underarms the only stump visible to send him back. Poor batting continues
full, on off, defended off the front foot

another awful piece of batting. Has an almighty slog at a full ball, Taylor is beaten by the half-volley, and they take byes. Mominum is almost gone as he takes the third bye, but the relay throw from Taylor is wide
full, outside off, driven to short cover
short of a length, looks to cut, can't beat point
short again, punched away off the back foot, to the left of deep point
flighted outside off, hits the pad, but he has got outside the line
dabbed away fine of short third man for one
short of a length, outside off, defended with an open face
short of a length, angling in, defended off the back foot
bouncer, just outside off, he sways out of its line. Called wide for height
full, middle and off, defended to mid-on
wide length ball, driven on the up, sweetly timed, placed in front of sweeper-cover. Top shot
short of a length, on off, pushed wide of cover for one
full and wide, hit straight to mid-off, but the pick-up is not clean and a risky single becomes an easy one
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on
wide of the crease, turning in too far, worked past short leg for one
tossed up on middle and off, defended off the back foot as it turns away
flighted again, defended off the front foot this time
another forward-defensive
and another block off the front foot ends a tight over
short of a length, on off, dabbed away to gully
short of a length, on off, defended with an open face
length ball, into the pads, worked away for a single
dabbed away to third man for one
short of a length, wide, nicely punched away with an open face. Beats the square field on the off side
on a length, on off, defended from the crease
and beats him first up. On a length, on off, Mominul is early into a loose drive. Lucky not to edge it
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
full and wide, pushed towards short cover, Butt's misfield allows then the single
on a length, outside off, pushed to long-off for one
short of a length, gets a bit big on him, hits the shoulder of the bat, but doesn't carry to point
short of a length, wide, punched away to deep point
tossed up wide, driven to deep cover for one
down the wicket, nearly beaten down the leg side, but he sticks out his pad. He gets a leg-bye. I am not sure he was playing a shot here
short of a length, punched back to him
too short, too wide, Hossain rocks back, and punches it in front of square. Beats deep cover with ease
short of a length, dabbed to the other side of deep cover this time, gets a socuple
full, just outside off, Hossain defends, is hit on the pad, but it is outside the line of off
on a length, gentle pace, beats him as it moves away from off
full and wide, driven away to long-off
on a length, just outside off, Hossain defends, inside-edges it onto his pad
short now, wide, Hossain is beaten on the cut. Called wide
full, outside off, driven to long-off
short of a length, on off, punched to long-off for another single
on a length, just outside off, defended back to HM
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, is hit on the pad, which saves him
short of a length, into the pads, worked away to leg for one
on a length, outside off, turning in, defended off the back foot
pushed to long-on for one
short of a length, on off, pushed back to him
slightly short, turning away, he has time to go back and punch it for a single to deep cover
full toss, middle and leg, smashed to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, wide, punched away to deep cover
low full toss, not timed at all, Masakadza fields in hos follow-through
full, half-volley, on off, defended back to him
short, outside leg, third boundary ball of the over, and finally it is dispatched. To long leg for four
very slow yorker, but it almost sneaks through. Mominul gets bat on it late, and takes a single to short fine
goes back to punch one to point. Sends back Hossain as the ball has gone straight to Williams
on a length, into the pads, pushed wide of midwicket. That's fifty for the stand
tossed up outside off, defended off the front foot
down the wicket, Utseya bowls flat, defended
full, on off, pushed back to him
short of a length, turning in, worked to leg for one
on a length, outside off, driven to long-off
short of a length, no room, pushed back to him
full and wide, driven to the left of deep cover for two
full and wide, squeezed out for a single to cover
short of a length, pulled to deep midwicket
short of a length, wide, Mominul waits for it, dabs down hard on it, to the right of point, gets four for this
full, on off, pushed to long-on
full, outside off, tapped away to point
on a length, goes back to push this to cover
goes back again, gets a single to deep cover
short of a length, into the pads, gets away with it as short fine leg is found
short and into the pads again, worked away for a single
full, outside off, the mid-off is up, and Hossain clears him with ease. Nice shot
full, outside off, this time driven to deep cover
full, middle and off, nearly a yorker, dug out back to him
short, into the pads, pulled away for a single
full, on off, pushed to long-on for one
looks to play off the back foot, the ball doesn't turn, and he has to hurry to bring the bat down in defence
full, on off, driven to long-on for one
full, outside off, Mominul stays back, and is beaten on the cut
tossed up outside off, hits the toe end of the bat as he drives
mis-hits a sweep, gets a single to short fine leg
short, stays a touch low, pulled wide of long-on for two
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
short of a length, into the body, pulled away for one

Chatara strikes. The extra pace does it for Mominul who has been scratching around. Wide length ball, clearly late into the drive, edges it through. Hang on. We are checking the no-ball. What a waste of time. He is nowhere close to over-stepping. More than half his foot is behind the line. That's his first ODI wicket
short of a length, angling in towards off, defended off the front foot
too full, too straight, wide down the leg side
short of a length, angling in towards off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, on off, dabbed away between cover and point, takes the single
short, cut away to the right of third man for a couple
full, outside off, defended off the front foot
plays a length ball off the back foot, bunts it into the leg side for one
down the wicket to push this to long-on for one
short of a length, punched between cover and point. Chakabva's dive there saves at least one run
down the wicket, defends this back to him
short again, this time he rocks back and punches it powerfully between cover and cover-point. That brings up his fifty too. Clearly head and shoulders above other Bangladesh batsmen
short of a length, runs it down to third man for one

that is not too short, but he goes for the pull, and is beaten by the low bounce. Misses the top of the stumps by not much. Taylor concedes a bye. sloppy work behind the stumps. No feet. Goes with one hand
pulled away, but mis-hit towards mid-on
full, on off, pushed to straight midwicket. Chakabva doesn't quite field the ball, but his quickness there causes enough doubt to keep the batsmen in their respective creases
on a length, into the pads, defended to leg
too short, pulled away sweetly in front of square. Deep midwicket can't do anything about it
short of a length, on off, dabbed away for a single
short of a length, gets big on him, hits the shoulder of the bat for a single to third man
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
short, rising towards the chest, he drops it at his boots and takes the single
on a length, middle and off, pushed to leg, but straight to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, drops it with soft hands, takes the single before point comes in
big wide outside off. Then it must be Chigumbura back into the attack
wide of the crease, too full, too straight, short fine leg is up, and has been picked away for an easy four
slightly short of a length, he pushes at it, and is beaten by the away movement
on a length, just outside off, pushed to leg for one
a good straight hit. On a length, middle and leg, chipped over the bowler's head. Long-on is straight, keeps them down to one
short of a length, wide, cut away to deep point
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for one
Hussain goes after him first ball. Down the wicket, to the pitch of the ball, and lofts him over long-on for six
too short, too straight, pulled away. Over short fine leg this time. Expected a short ball, and stayed deep in his crease
short of a length, cut away in front of square, finds extra cover
down the wicket, is a little surprised by the full toss, and plays it back to him
driven to mid-on. Three dots in a row
driven to long-on for one
short of a length, on off, beaten on the attempt to late-cut it
lofted away down the ground. Gets a single to long-on. Good job he mis-hit it, otherwise he could have been caught
short of a length, pushed to the right of point, takes a single
cut away, but can't beat Williams at point
slower ball, full on the pads, worked away to leg for one
short of a length, holds its line, beats his poke
upper-cut straight to deep point. That's a lucky break for Zimbabwe. This is short and wide, but he has found the fielder with it
down the wicket first ball, is hit on the shoulder with the bouncer. He gets a leg-bye by the virtue of that protective-action rule, but nobody deserves a run for this
hit straight to straight midwicket
full, on off, driven to long-on for one
wide and short, he moves across, closer to the line of the ball, and cuts it over the ring
driven to long-on for one
lucky runs. A dip in the pool really. Down the wicket, slogs at it, gets a bottom edge between the keeper and short fine leg
slower ball, beats his slog by a long distance
moves across, is done in by the slower one again. Takes a single to cover
wide down the leg side with fine leg up. Fifteen wides now
on a length, outside off, played with soft hands, gets a single to cover
low full toss, nearly a yorker. They get a leg-bye despite another ungainly miss from Zia
another wide down the leg side. That's 16 of them. Nearly three extra overs
on a length, on off, pushed to long-on for one
on a length, angling in, he gets a leading edge, to the right of the bowler
down the wicket to slog this short ball to deep midwicket
down the wicket, right to the pitch of the ball, drives nicely, to the left of long-on, where Butt makes a good diving save
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for a single
slogs a full ball to deep midwicket for one
yorker, on off, toe-ended into the pad

nearly drops it. Ziaur's ungainly stay comes to an end. He charges at Chatara, lofts down the ground, connects well, but these are no Mickey-Mouse boundaries, and Chakabva gets under an easy catch. The ball bursts through to hit his chest, but he collects the rebound
another wide down the leg side. Seventeenth of the innings
pulled away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, on the pads, bunted into the leg side, and the huge outfield allows them a second
short of a length, punched to extra cover. They take the single, and had Waller hit Razzak was a goner
slower ball, full, on off, gets a single to wide long-on
short of a length, wide down the leg side, but not given as Razzak has moved across the line. Seems to have got away with one  there
down the wicket, drives this to wide long-on for one
pulled down the ground, takes two as this is placed straight of long-on
driven to long-on for one
yorker on off, dug out to extra cover
nearly a yorker again, dug out for just the single
another yorker, another single. Superb over
pulled wide of deep midwicket where Waller and Chikabva get into some tag-team work to save possibly two and at least one
short again, and Mahmudullah has smacked this despite having charged at him. Pulled between long-on and deep midwicket
Mahmudullah has moved too far across, and is beaten by a wide slower ball
backs away, Chatara bowls a yorker that follows him. Dug out to cover for one
short, on the stumps, nicely played by moving inside the line and pulling it past short fine leg. Poor over so far
full and outside off, driven to mid-off
full and straight, driven to long-on for one
slower ball, beats the almighty heave from Mahmudullah. Knocks back the off stump with one from the back of the hand. He has four now. And four balls left to try to take a maiden five-for
full toss, middle and leg, gets a single to long-on
that's three extra overs bowled. Wide No. 18. So wide outside off this might have been called in Tests
moves across, nearly done in by the yorker. They will take the single, though
another slower ball, beats the slog, but Taylor concedes the bye
full and straight, driven straight past Shingi's outstretched hand. Gets a couple

inn2.comm: starts with an outswinger outside off. Left alone
stays with the outswinger. A misfield at short cover by Mahmudullah allows them the single
full outswinger again, this time Mahmudullah makes a diving save at short cover
too straight, on the pads, worked away to long leg
on a length, on off, swinging away, defended to cover
no-ball. The first no-ball ever for knocking over the stumps at the non-striker's end. He has demolished the stump with his foot. Short and wide, cut away to point
swinging in, beats the inside edge, but is headed down leg
this one holds its line outside off. Left alone
another ball that holds its line outside off. Left alone again
short, wide, beats his cut, but is also called wide
bowled'im. As has been the norm today, another wicket has been gifted. This is wide, on a length, Chakabva pushes at it away from the body, gets an inside edge onto the stumps
short of a length, into the pads, tucked away nicely for a couple to the left of long leg
outswinger, starts too wide, easy to leave alone
wide half-volley, Masakadza has tucked into it, driving it through square cover for four
too full again, but this time he has been driven to mid-on
full outside off, drives hard at it, gets a meaty inside edge for a single
short, wide, called a wide, and rightly too
nice delivery. Short of a length, middle and off, swings against the angle, squares him up with defence
another outswinger, squares him up again, and beats the bat
stays with those shortish outswingers. Runs off the outside half of the bat for one

Islam is on fire. Butt's debut has not ended well. That's full and fast, Butt has closed the face a touch to play it to leg, and the ball has jagged back in after pitching to knock the middle stump out of the ground
immediate injection of class with Taylor coming in. Short of a length, outside off, punched away in front of square for four. First ball, that too
full, outside off, left alone. The ball shapes back in, exciting the bowler, but doesn't threaten the stumps
short of a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, swinging in, defended off the back foot
wide down the leg side. So big a wide he can just get a hand to it. They will run one too
full, swinging in, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, wide, he goes back and across to punch it between cover-point and point for four
short of a length, closer to off, left alone
fuller, middle and off, swinging away, Taylor defends off the back foot
short of a length, just outside off, punched to cover
stays short of a length, gets it to rise appreciably, Taylor defends off the back foot
on a length, on off, holding its line, defended
on a length, outside off, defended to cover
big wide down the leg side
another nice shot. Wide length ball, he moves across, close to the line of the ball, drives it through cover. Just a push
angling into the pads, Masakadza misses out as he is early on the clip
swinging in towards middle, nicely picked away past mid-on for a couple
That's trademark Masakadza. Gets under a length ball, and lofts it over mid-on
short of a length, on off, punched to mid-on
on a length, shapes away a little, played with soft hands, gets a single to point
lovely bowling. Not short, but not drivable length either. Swings away from just outside off. Beats the outside edge
goes too straight this time, pushed wide of mid-on for one
short, outside off, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
on a length, outside off, nicely dabbed away to third man
throws his hands at a shortish wide ball, no slip in place, and the thick edge flies for four
huge lbw shout, but this bowled from wide of the crease and is swinging in. Beats the drive by a long way, hits him in front of leg. Sliding down, I'd say
defended off the front foot this time
on a length, hits the inside half of the bat as HM defends
on a length, swinging in, defended off the front foot
slower ball, Masakadza adjusts well, drops it at his feet and runs a single
short of a length, wide, pushed to short cover
driven off the back foot, but can't beat cover-point
hit hard, but straight at short cover. This was short and wide, Mahmudullah has done well at short cover
full, this one moves back in, hits the inside half of the bat
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
charges at him, Masakadza is a little uneasy after all these dots. Has to check his drive as Robiul bowls a little short. Goes off the outside half of the bat to point
that's a maiden. On off, shortish, defended from the crease
full, middle and off, defended to leg
full, outside off, defended after getting a stride in
swinging in towards off, Taylor defends watchfully again. No run for 10 balls
the pressure is telling. Taylor drives at a wide one, it goes off the thick outside edge for three through gully
was that deliberate? Seemed thus to me. Short of a length, just outside off, he leans back to make a bit of room, opens the face, guides it fine past the keeper
on a length, on the pads, whipped away past square leg
defended off the front foot
short of a length, outside off, punched away for a single
on a length, goes back to drive it off the back foot, finds point
flighted outside off, gets it to dip, HM drives with hard hands, sends it uppishly towards point
stays back to defend this to mid-off
flighted, doesn't turn, takes the inside edge onto the pad
slow through the air, full, pushed to long-off for one
Masakadza takes on Shakib. First ball and he is down the track to take this on a half-volley and send it flying over long-on
full, driven inside-out to long-off
down the leg side, leg-bye to short fine
punched away to deep cover
driven down to long-off for one
short of a length, on off, punched to long-on for one
stays back to push this length ball to long-on
defended off the front foot
punched down to long-on for one
stays back to defend a length ball to cover-point
on a length, angling in, defended to midwicket
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover-point
nearly the wicket. Well bowled. Gets some shape away after pitching on a length. Taylor pushes at it. The edge goes wide of the keeper. No slip in place
into the pads, pushed to short fine leg
short of a length, on off, pushed to long-on for one
walks down and across to dab this to third man for one
full, on the pads, clipped away off the toes for one
some turn away after pitching middle and leg. Defended off the front foot
on a length, on off, defended
shortish, cut away to deep point for one
short of a length, cut away to deep point again
off stump out of the ground. Razzak does it with the non-turner. Short of a length, outside off, this one goes on with the arm, beats the inside edge by a long way, and the top of off is hit. Timbah
this one seems to have turned away from the left-hand batsman. Defended off the front foot
down the wicket to drive this length ball to long-on
short of a length, on off, defended to cover-point
gets a bottom edge as he dabs away from the body. Safely far from the stumps, though
full and wide, driven straight to cover
short of a length, outside off, defended to mid-off
driven uppishly, over cover. Threw his hands at a wide ball, which excited everybody, but he managed to lob cover successfully
short of a length, on off, punched down to long-on
turning into the pads, worked away for one
tossed up on off, defended to cover
wide half-volley, driven to short cover
nicely bowled. Considerably slower than usual, turns away after dipping, takes the outside edge, but there is no slip for Masakadza
nice turn there, from middle and leg, Masakadza has to be watchful in defence
wide half-volley, driven to the left of deep cover
on a length, middle and leg, worked away to leg
down the wicket, pushed back to Zia, who throws down the off stump, but HM is in
down the wicket again, is beaten by the movement inwards, but Masakadza has got himself outside the line of off
short of a length, outside off, punched to the right of point for a single
slower ball, moves across to work this to midwicket for one
full, middle and leg, worked away off the toes for one
down the wicket to defend to cover
this one doesn't turn, and beats the outside edge on the drive

given without replays. Down the wicket, pushes this to cover, goes through for the non-existent single. The throw is quick if not all that accurate, and Mushfiqur does well with the collection and the breaking of the wicket
defended to cover
angling in, pushed to midwicket

this is dead plumb. Maskadza has finally fallen. Bangladesh sense the win now. Masakadza walks down the wicket, but Zia gets it to swing in from outside off, and hits him in front. Not the best of shots
wide length ball, pushed on the up, to cover
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover
horrible slog across the line. Zia bowls on a length, on off, he swipes across the line. Off stump goes for a walk. Elton can keep his high-tea appointment now
short of a length, on off, hits the shoulder of the bat
full, outside off, driven to short cover. Double-wicket maiden. This has surely killed off the chase
stays back to defend a length ball
slow through the air, defended in front of off
flighted on off again, blocked off the front foot
tossed up wide, cut straight to point
flat, outside off, defended off the back foot
flighted high, middle and leg, defended again. Two maidens in a row
on a length, on off, defended from the crease

another wicket gone. Hold on. They are checking if the catch is clean. This was short of a length, and wide, and he has punched this uppishly towards point. We are going to check the replays, which are not conclusive with this coverage. You cannot tell anything at all if it has been caught on a half-volley or on the full. Mominul is confident. This replay will give the batsman the benefit of the doubt. One day, I will like to see an umpire say I was watching and I know what happened. Especially with such a challenged coverage. Oh surprise surprise. They have given this
short of a length, into the pads, defended to leg
first run in 21 balls. Off the outside edge, past slip for one
defended off the front foot
moves across, pushes at a widish shortish delivery. beaten. And this is a no-ball because Zia has knocked over the bail at the non-striker's end as he delivers
on a length, on off, off the inside edge it goes for two
stays back to defend a length ball
defended off the back foot
angled down, hits the pad
tossed up on off, defended off the front foot
full and flat, defended off the front foot
short of a length, defended off the back foot
length ball outside off, steers it to third man for one
stays back to defend a length ball with an open face
wide length ball, left alone
dug in short, pulled away to deep square leg for one
moves across to defend a length ball outside off
defended off the front foot, to cover
slow through the air, dips on him outside off, turns away to beat the outside edge
slogged away. Shakib hit for a six again. By the other Masakadza this time. Clears the front leg, and sweeps him over wide long-on
swept away for a single this time
tossed up outside off, pushed wide of point
flighted on off, defended to cover
arm ball, on off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, throws his hands at it, the outside edge flies of wide slip
full, swinging in, defended to mid-off
full, pushed to mid-off for a risky single. There is no direct hit to make this interesting
swinging in a touch, defended off the back foot
full, swinging in, defended off the front foot
short of a length, widish, punched away past point for one
another slog against Shakib. Over midwicket it goes for three
flighted, slow in the air, pushed to cover, takes the single, but not before hesitation, and had the throw been accurate Waller was gone
driven to long-off for one
punched away to deep cover for one
punched to long-on for one
cut away. And this is a length ball he has gone back to. Beats the sweeper-cover too
wide length ball, left alone
on a length outside off, pushed to the right of point for one
short of a length, into the pads, concedes a leg-bye
short of a length, outside off, defended to point. Shingi is sent back. Nearly run out
on a length, angling in towards off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, wide, punched away to deep cover
short of a length, outside off, defended back to him
nice shot. Half-volley outside off, he moves across near the line, and drives this over extra cover
defended off the back foot
pushed wide of cover off the back foot
flighted outside off, driven to cover-point
short. Long hop. Shingi rocks back and pulls this clean over deep midwicket. The Masakadzas might end up losing, but they are hitting the sixes
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
hooked away. That's some shot. He has taken this bouncer from well outside off, and smacked it over midwicket
short of a length, into the pads, pushed to the right of midwicket for one
defended off the front foot
full, on off, defended back to him
on a length, angling in towards off, defended off the back foot
and short he bowls. Wide too. Cut away for one
full, on off, defended with an open face
pushed to sweeper-cover for one
full, on off, defended to cover
cut away nicely. Mominul is bowling too short, and this time he has been cut to the left of deep cover. Fifty for this stand
full, outside off, driven to sweeper-cover
starts with a wide down the leg side
appeal for lbw as this one nips back in, but Masakadza has got outside the line of off
on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
and finally the slog gets Bangladesh the wicket. This partnership much have frustrated Bangladesh, but Zia has come back and broken through. Waller swipes across the line, and misses, and is bowled

that's five for Zia. he began the day with an average for 100. What a game cricket is. This one nips back in from a length just outside off, and traps him dead in front. Can Zia finish this off with a hat-trick?

how close has he come to a hat-trick? He had it, for mine, but the big stride from Chatara seems to have saved him. This was straight, just short of a length, seamed in, and trapped him in front. Not given. I can only imagine the stride saved him
another appeal for lbw. A smiliar delivery really except that this one has taken the inside edge
it's over. Robiul gets the wicket with a full and straight delivery. This hits him middle and leg, and would have taken leg
